Module 2: Numeric Questions

For students

Last updated: 11/08/2025 14:33

The questions are based on or inspired by the following references:

  • Berk & DeMarzo, Corporate Finance, 5th ed. (2020)
  • Brealey & Myers, Principles of Corporate Finance, 13th ed. (2020)

üìò Part 1 (until Midterm)

ch10 üéûÔ∏è ‚úÖ ‚ùì üî¢ üìù

Answer the following questions based on the discussions in class.

Login

CAPM Cost of Capital

Suppose the market risk premium is 8.02% and the risk‚Äëfree interest rate is 4.99%.

‚úÖ Cost of capital = rf + Œ≤ √ó mrp = 10.82.

Buy-hold Return

You bought a stock for $ 51.3 per share and sold it later for $ 56.04. It paid $ 2.44 in dividends over the period.

‚úÖ Holding period return = (p_sell ‚àí p_buy + div_yield)/p_buy √ó 100 = 14.02%.

Total and Annualized Return Over Multiple Years

You bought a stock for $97.88 per share and sold it for $113.82 after 1 years. You received $2.56 in dividends per year.

‚úÖ Total return = (p2 ‚àí p1 + div √ó years)/p1 √ó 100 = 18.89%.

‚úÖ Annualized return (CAGR) = [((p2 + div √ó years)/p1)^(1/years) ‚àí 1] √ó 100 = 18.89%.

Average and Standard Deviation of Returns

The past five annual returns of a stock were (in %): 8.96, 11.52, 5.69, 8.08, 7.96

‚úÖ Average return = mean(returns) = 8.44%.

‚úÖ Standard deviation = sd(returns) = 2.1%.

Expected Return of a Mixed Portfolio

Suppose you invest 24.3% of your wealth in the market portfolio, which has an expected return of 8.19%, and the remainder in the risk‚Äëfree asset, which has a return of 2.57%.

‚úÖ Expected portfolio return = rm * w + rf * (1-w)= 3.94%.

Portfolio Return from Two Stocks

You invested 31.9% of your capital in Stock A, which returned 6.36%, and the remainder in Stock B, which returned 9.87%.

‚úÖ Portfolio return = w√órA + (1 ‚àí w)√órB = 8.75%.

Compounded Annual Return from Semi‚ÄëAnnual Returns

A stock returned 1.08% in the first half of the year and 3.66% in the second half of the year.

‚úÖ Total annual return = (1 + r‚ÇÅ/100) √ó (1 + r‚ÇÇ/100) ‚àí 1 = 4.79%.

Arithmetic vs. Geometric Average Return

A stock yielded returns of 11.42% and 10.82% over two consecutive years.

‚úÖ Arithmetic average return = (r1 + r2)/2 = 11.12%.

‚úÖ Geometric average return = [(1 + r1/100) √ó (1 + r2/100)]¬π·êü¬≤ ‚àí 1 = 11.12%.

Market Risk Premium and Expected Return

The risk‚Äëfree rate is 2.65%, the expected market return is 9.74%, and the beta of a stock is 1.26.

‚úÖ Market risk premium = rm ‚àí rf = 7.08%.

‚úÖ Expected return = rf + Œ≤ √ó (rm ‚àí rf) = 11.56%.
